abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Second Highway Rehabilitation Project (HRP2) in
            Indonesia, which improves the national road infrastructure.
            Persons displaced by land or house acquisition will receive
            compensation, relocation, and/or rehabilitation according to
            the resettlement action plan. All trees, saplings, and
            shrubbery will be protected from unnecessary damage.
            Thereafter, reseeding, replanting, or restoration will
            prevent further damage (i.e. erosion) and restore
            quasi-original conditions. After their use, borrow pits and
            other material resource areas will be landscaped and planted
            to provide substitute areas for displaced natural habitats
            or other appropriate land use. Wastewater will be treated by
            using settling ponds, gravel filters, or other processes so
            as not to impair water quality or harm aquatic life. Dust
            from vehicles or equipment will be minimized by regularly
            sprinkling water or other acceptable methods. Waste
            materials, brush, or trees will be burned only under
            favorable weather conditions. To minimize traffic delays and
            to protect pedestrians along work areas, temporary access
            will be provided to residents.  Construction activities will
            be limited to daytime hours.  Noise, from blasting, hauling,
            and other such operations will be minimized by using
            low-noise machines. Route and timing of material transport
            will be carefully selected to minimize impacts on schools,
            hospitals, and environmentally sensitive facilities.
